author: sats
title: Konma Upskill
description: インドは第2位の人口を抱える多言語国家であり、母国語でカルダノについて教育することで、強力なコミュニティを構築することができます。

f6_assessments.q0: India will be an emerging powerhouse in the near future. And with a population as big as India's, creating translated content directed towards them is a natural reflex. However, the proposal does not direct itsself towards all of India. It does so towards the Tamil population who are about 70M strong. Which is not few, but worth noting when assessing impact as the total influx potential spans 70M.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the organisational skills of this proposal, there is somewhat a professional impression present. I am assuming that once the Tamil version is online, it will be easily transferable to other languages in the region as well, expanding the reach of the project. One point of improvement is not only naming the skills of the executing team, but also the team itsself so it becomes apparent if the team holds enough members and who these people are.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has very distinct KPIs, which makes tracking the proposal after funding success quite easy. There is a roadmap along with a budget breakdown, which is great. The proposal could be improved significantly by specifying more information on the team members.

f6_assessments.q0: Love the goals for outreach to India. Providing and building learning modules that can be accessed by individuals that speak a diverse range of languages in the 2nd most populated country is incredible
f6_assessments.q1: The plan provides a detailed roadmap. The external links in the linktree are super helpful to understand the depth of knowledge and diversity of experience this project brings to the ADA network.
f6_assessments.q2: The only thing i would have loved to see in this project is more detailed understanding of where/who is being outreached. What partnerships will be developed?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies the problem of translating Cardano's contents into native Indian languages. As a solution, it proposes the creation of multilingual content in an online and offline model. I consider this a great idea to include Tamil speakers in the Cardano community. And this proposal is in line with the multilingual challenge of attracting non-English speakers to the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal does not present a plan to remain financially sustainable in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not present who are the team members who will work on the project and what their experiences are. The budget was detailed, and I thought it was overpriced. I'm not sure about the deadline for completion of the work, I'm worried that there will be little time to reach all the goals. The proposer presented a detailed plan of what will be done in the project and described what resources will be needed to implement the proposal. Challenges for implementing the work were considered.
f6_assessments.q2: It was clearly explained what the target problem is and what was the solution presented. The proposal presented a roadmap with milestones that is important for monitoring the work's progress. And KPIs were also provided to monitor the proposal's success.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely that  Tamil speakers can not access easy information about Cardano and Catalyst and theres no community for Cardano.It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by creating a community around Cardano for Tamil speakers. This proposal shows somewhat how it adds value to the Cardano system as it would create a community built around their proprietary LMS. This may be a disadvantage where since its proprietary it may have vulnerabilities.Key metrics are clear, reasonable and realistic. These include Number of students on the LMS, No of members opting for courses, daily increase of members, of community, No of comments, posts, shares. The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge. The list of metrics and KPIs is not very comprehensive but what they have included is well laid out. It is a complex plan, and may require many skillsets which are being sourced from external providers, to execute.   Proposal can scale to address future challenges by further adding languages and courses. This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the awareness and knowledge among non English speaking newcomes to DLT and Cardano starting from Tamil Community.I cannot say that this project adequately addresses the challenge but I also say it would be useful hence i have given it a 3 star rating.
It is a complex project.

If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to build and send press releases to media of your country or social media relating to your subject. Sometimes that one step might motivate someone to view the link and add credibility for your project and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers have  not provided evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in building these sort of projects. The Linkedin Profiles of Core leadership has not been provided. They have provided the link to their F7 project page. While the concept is simple,no proof has been given that they are able to execute this plan. The links are not sufficient. I have visited the links.but its to the corporate site, not anything of the proposers themselves. I cannot assess if the proposer is competent to build this content since no information has been given as to prior experience in this area. The site details various projects that Konma want s to do.The proposal   has indicated the core leadership. 
There is no guarantee if  they would be competent in providing this service in an efficient and timely manner.
He has not provided the team structure of members and their capabilities and has mentioned other partners who he would work with such as web developers, translators, voice over specialists, trainers, LMS developers. 
 The budget has  been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items.  The budget is  not reasonable to achieve the set goals.  The costs are higher than I feel are reasonable. For example 250 USD for a video  and 125 USD for a podcast episode seems somewhat high to be reasonable. 300 USD per month for 3 posts and 5 stories per week is high.

The proposer has not provided a verifiable p. lan if additional funding is required . 
There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met.  
The timetable is realstic to build the tools and related research.
The proposal gives a sensible and conductible plan for implementation. It has a plan stated with detailed breakdown in terms of the various stages of development. Whether these can be accomplished or not cannot be determined since we dont know the capability of the team.
Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are described.   

The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed 
The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal.   Given experience and plan presented this proposal may be implemented successfully hence I have given it a 2 star rating. Also I have rated it like this because the budget is too high for such a project. 

A piece of advice... You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise. A proposer who has considered this, would be looked on more favorably since it shows that they are prepared for various situations and eventualities
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. There are some clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal. A marketing budget has been allocated. 
There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem 
and there is a solution. Only issue is price is comparatively high.
The proposer has identified some possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties such as translation of technical terms.
The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence I have given it a 4 star rating.
 
Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal identifies a large population for which Cardano is currently not very accessible, Tamil, with 70 million speakers around the globe.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has some technical background and experience in web3 development. At least one of them has taken the Emurgo Cardano certification. 

The reason why the proposal is not given five stars is a certain lack of presentation of the team's skills. Through some LinkedIn investigation it was possible to find some evidence that the team has done programmer training and has some marketing expertise.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is very clear and they also list KPIs in a concise manner which allows for auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aligned with the challenge setting, which is to bring Tamil speaking community using Konma Upskill and the Konma Xperience Centers (another proposal) to create awareness about Cardano Ecosystem and the scope for the future. By building this, it will further help people who have interest to learn Cardano but struggled with language barrier. There are around 70 million Tamil-speaking people globally, from countries like Sri Lanka, Malaysia, Singapore and Mauritius.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the proposer didn't have their team already set-up, they're are able to identify the people to recruit (e.g skills required like certified domain experts, LMS developers, translator to work on English content to Tamil, etc). Budget have been broken down into details, such as the short education video, modules, podcast content, etc. This further proves that they are able to identify the resource needed to implement this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: They have the roadmap explained in details. Metrics and KPIs also explained in detailed manner, from month 1 until month 4. The audit process should be viable considering they will have a social media account to post their progress and events.

f6_assessments.q0:
With around 70 million Tamil-speaking in the world, building a program that helps that community aware of the Cardano ecosystem and the scope of the future is necessary. Inside the proposal, the team shows off that their project will directly impact strongly to the Cardano ecosystem, and with their plan I believe that they can. 
Moreover, their inspiring KPIs is also proving that they're motivated a lot by the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has a very detailed roadmap in 4 months of implementing their plan, and all the budget is reasonable for that plan. 
They also have a solid plan that to help get their goals, their vision for this project. 
The team doesn't show any risk in their plan, but I think this is not too simple plan of content production only but include event organization, communication... so, hope that they can figure out some risks and have plans for them.
f6_assessments.q2:
They have a detailed roadmap, inspired KPIs after 4 months, and action plans that can help CA audit their project well. 
The team also states the content of the problem in very detail, and that help their solution make sense in addressing the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to create multilingual content and provide education in a language comfortable for them in an online and offline model which will help build a strong Cardano community through their native language alongside English language. The challenge is well addressed.
f6_assessments.q1: The Team has certified domain experts, train the trainer, social media influencers, content creators who all will make implementation successful. The detailed plan includes among others, the Community will share knowledge , have regular weekly meetups, create workshops, use social media to reach the masses, utilize platforms such as clubhouse, create podcast modules. All will help implement successfully according to the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is clear from 1st  month to 4th month showing details in the proposal. The budget is well broken down for effective auditing. Good proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge as it wants to create a community for discussing about blockchain/ Cardano/ Catalyst for Tamil speaking people via online platforms to offline workshops (which will be held in the Konma Xperience Centers, another potential proposal in Fund 7).
f6_assessments.q1: This has almost everything needed to be feasible to implement, except for the team, there is no information introduces or describe team members and scope of work for each person. I tried to find out using the link of Konma webisite but still can't figure out. Therefore I rate 4 for feasibility. Hope the proposers will fill this up.
f6_assessments.q2: I see the KPIs hasn't been written completely in the proposal and remained unspecific. There is no key metrics to define how success looks like though the development plan is good. Therefore I rate 3 for the auditability of this proposal. Since this is a potential project, I advice the proposer to work on it more.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal thoroughly addresses the challenge. It is aimed at more than 70 million Tamil language speakers, who are not only in India but also in various countries such as Sri Lanka, Malaysia, Singapore and Mauritius.
Konma Upskill aims to create multilingual content and provide education in a language comfortable for them in an online and offline model.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the team has sufficient evidence to demonstrate the skills and experience needed to implement the proposal, it would be interesting to know the profile of the people involved. It is also important to have more detail regarding the number of people involved, estimate hours, amount per hour and allocated budget to the different work packages for project implementation.
I am very impressed with the way the proponents build the club, community, marketing, communication. The road map is very clear, identifying what to do in each specific stage, making it easy for everyone to follow and evaluate.
"Short Education Videos (3-5 minutes, weekly 1 video) " - 1 week post a video about 5 minutes long, I think it is not enough to convey relevant knowledge.
f6_assessments.q2:
This is a potential project, another detailed roadmap / KPI, but to be successful, it is necessary to add and edit some content:
Provide profiles of participants, increase video length, video posting frequency (as mentioned in the previous section)
Tamil speakers are not only in India, but also in various countries like Sri Lanka, Malaysia, Singapore and Mauritius. So where will the Konma Xperience Center be built? What cost? It is not mentioned in the proposal.
The budget request is $20100, although a budget breakdown has been provided, it is not detailed yet. "Learning Modules" and "Targeted Paid Promotions" are two parts that need clarification. In addition, it is necessary to have a long-term budget allocation plan, determine the total number of project participants, working hours, and price per hour, thereby allocating budgets for work blocks. a reasonable way.
I think this project is still possible if the proposer provides more information above, this is a great offer, don't give up.

solution: Konma Upskillは、多言語コンテンツを作成し、オンラインとオフラインのモデルで、彼らにとって快適な言語で教育を提供することを目指しています。
experience: チームには、認定されたドメインエキスパート、トレーナー、ソーシャルメディアインフルエンサー、コンテンツクリエーターがおり、コミュニティをまとめて運営することができます。
